item.title: David add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "One of the great tragedies of mankind is that morality has been hijacked by religion. So now people assume that religion and morality have a necessary connection. But the basis of morality is really very simple and doesn't require religion at all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: David add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Physics is like sex: sure, it may give some practical results, but that's not why we do it." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: David add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: David add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Creationists make it sound as though a 'theory' is something you dreamt up after being drunk all night." -- Isaac Asimov
